abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission is making a major change in how it settles some securities fraud cases, telling companies that they will no longer be allowed to say they neither admit nor deny the commission's civil charges when, at the same time, they admit to or have been convicted of criminal violations.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission is making a major change in how it settles some securities fraud cases, telling companies that they will no longer be allowed to say they neither admit nor deny the commission's civil charges when, at the same time, they admit to or have been convicted of criminal violations, Edward Wyatt of The New York Times reports.
